website_summaries.verdict: True to its name, this printer rarely requires ink refills, and it prints documents reliably.
pros: This is a reliable all-in-one printer that features scanning and copying features and includes a 2 yr. supply of ink
The ability to print wirelessly from Android, Chrome OS, and Apple devices is convenient
cons: Setup can be time-consuming, and images may appear slightly blurry
The high price may be hard to justify for some

website_summaries.verdict: A good buy if you are tired of hassling with the cost and replacement of ink cartridges and don't mind the reduced print quality.
pros: Easy on the environment and the wallet with its cartridge-free printing – has a spacious ink tank that is easy to fill
It's quiet when it prints, and includes a scanner and copier
cons: The trade off for the affordable ink is copies that are slightly grainy and not as crisp as other models
Some issues with WiFi connectivity have been reported

customer_reviews.title: Time to begin researching color laser printers
customer_reviews.text: Done with inkjet printers for good. Like many, I bought this in the hope that it would mitigate constantly ordering ink carts. Well, that it did. However, in less than a year, the print quality became unusable like all inkjets. They all get issues with the print head or nozzles, and no amount of cleaning or repair ever seems to resolve everything printing in magenta. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MtotheH

customer_reviews.title: I should have switched to this sooner - it would have saved me so much money.
customer_reviews.text: Prints high quality in both full color and greyscale, and ink is so much cheaper that it's a no brainer. I used an Epson XP-800 before this and switched because I was tired of paying $71 for a set of replacement cartridges that I would go through every 4-6 months. By my estimate, it will pay for itself in about a year and a half at my current printing volume.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Proseus

customer_reviews.title: Terrible spotty/ line skipping printer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer back in October and have only used it no more than ten times to print some things here and there. Every time I print, the papers come out all spotty and missing lots of lines. Ive ran through the self clean several times and nothing has helped fix this problem. I know I am not out of ink because I have not used this printer more than 10 times. I checked the ink levels and they're all full. It's a shame that it just started doing this because this product sucks. It is terrible. No way I can return it now. It has been way past 30 days. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: iAmKristofer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Printer!
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this printer to make prints for his growing art business. We are super thrilled with this printer! We have made so many prints and the ink has barely budged! The prints look beautiful and it has made a huge improvement in our life. This printer is fantastic in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amber LackieTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Efficient Printer
customer_reviews.text: The tanks are fabulous! Works well, although a bit slow making a copy from a scan. Quality is very good.Small and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne McCulloch

customer_reviews.title: The best I can say about this printer is that it ...
customer_reviews.text: I've learned my lesson to read the reviews before I purchase a printer again. The best I can say about this printer is that it prints. I wish I would have kept my previous printer, a 6 year old HP 7520 All-in-one printer, and just got it fixed. This printer is so slow, scanning is terrible and all the critical reviews that I have now read are very true. I have experienced the same things. I honestly HATE this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Joseph Hakes

customer_reviews.title: Not a photo printer
customer_reviews.text: Love the concept of refilling ink at 2-year intervals. Printed documents are good. Photos are disappointing; not sharp, and colors are not satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Smith

customer_reviews.title: The 2650 is a new and improved model
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Epson printer, and the best. Epson has improved the ink capacity so that the 2650 will hold an entire bottle of ink where as my older designed model 2550 needed to be refiled more often. (Filling can be messy. Users should wear disposable gloves per instructions). The 2650 also has a better ink feed mechanism than the 2550. The on screen ink level monitor should be more reliable. Both the 2650 and the 2550 make very good prints, and at a fraction of the cost of cartridge printers. Replacement ink can be purchased on the inter net. A year supply costs about $70.00.
customer_reviews.author: MAT in Sun City Center,FL

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS ECO TANK printer
customer_reviews.text: REALLY NICE Printer This is was i was looking for!!! After buying cheaper options i finally decided to get a better quality much more expensive printer, the INK will LAST YOU 2 years according to the company, It will print up to 4,000 pages black/6,500 color. I LOVE CARTRIDGE FREE printing after all this years i wanted to break free from that! Very easy to install and configure, i was able to get the app on my phone and print from anywhere as long as the printer in ON and on your wireless network you will be able to print.
customer_reviews.author: Marquino Gadget guru

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with just about everything about this printer. At least to date. I would have liked the "screen" to be a bit bigger; and, it took me awhile to understand some of the menu items and how to access them. I was surprized that when I selected "two-sided printing," it simply printed every-other page and then instsructed me to reinsert. I had become used to a printer that dis both sides before ejecting the pages.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thvedt

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to use and prints beautifully. I love the crisp print and quietness of the machine. Plus, the ink will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Faucett

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: The set up on this was so easy. I create greeting cards and have printed countless cards which require a lot of color and the ink levels haven't changed at all. I am amazed by this product. I was spending $80/month on cartridges to support what I do and don't know why I didn't invest in this sooner. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. I have had it for several months now and haven't had to add any ink. My black is about half full and the colors have barely dropped at all. I am a school teacher and print a lot of stuff for my classroom. I love the fact that I can refill yellow, if that is the color I have ran out of, without throwing away whats left of red and blue like I did with my previous printer.
customer_reviews.author: AngPang50

customer_reviews.title: A great home or office printer!
customer_reviews.text: The print quality is fine for the average print job, but it's not as fine as I would have liked. That aside, this printer is AWESOME. I'm able to print easily from all of my smart devices quickly. I don't know if I'm ever going to use up all of the ink that came included. I've printed at least 200 sheets so far and I haven't seen the blank ink budge, and the other colors don't look like they've been affected at all. Firmware updates are simple and intuitive. Setting up the printer on our home network took no time at all. When the time to upgrade comes, I will be returning to Epson's EcoTank line.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Smotherman

customer_reviews.title: POC...has not lasted very long and is already problematic
customer_reviews.text: I received this printer on 8-29-17 and it is already having problems. I've run the nozzle check and cleaned it. Still not working properly. Only prints black OK...not colors
customer_reviews.author: Jenni Angeles

customer_reviews.title: I like the EcoTank idea
customer_reviews.text: I like the EcoTank idea, however, the wireless connection is not consistent. Tried on both Mac and PC, was able to complete the initial set up on Mac without a problem, but when turn on the Mac very next time it showing the printer is offline although verified the printer is connected to the Wi-Fi network. PC set up is much more difficult, my laptop just can't find the printer on the network. Received an error message something like printer is not compatible to the Wi-Fi network.
customer_reviews.author: W. W.

customer_reviews.title: It's bearly good enought to print letters
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Epson printers for years this is by far the worst printer I have ever purchased. it can't handle premium matted paper. bends end leaves black ink stains pulls in uneven even though I have to feeder aligned perfectly. Doesn't do borderless wish I would have check to see if it had that feature wouldn't have bought it if I had known. If this poor quality is what we can expect from the eco tank line then it's a no go ..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing. Amazing amazing. So thankful! Great printer!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Freaking thing is awesome! Ive printed at LEAST 2,000 pages full color. Still runs like a champ. Been 6 months at least! We use it very frequently. My bluetooth finds it and wifi no problems! Used to load cartridges more frequently than gas in my truck, but this thing is as friendly as a geo metro compared to my other "low ink printer"... Definitely definitely definitely recommend this! Buyyy ittt!!
customer_reviews.author: Gesture

customer_reviews.title: It didn't last
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Prints are decent quality. Love the refillable ink tanks. The reason I purchased this printer is for use in my business. Update: after only 417 prints there is a problem. Ink tanks are still 2/3 full, but the yellow and magenta inks are not coming out. Have run the clean print head and check nozzles several times, still not working correctly. Not happy, especially since I have large refill bottles for a broken printer I will have to now replace.
customer_reviews.author: Life in NE WA State

customer_reviews.title: I don't like to write negative reviews
customer_reviews.text: We have spent more time figuring out how to handle the error messages than we have printing. I don't like to write negative reviews, but save everyone the time of shipping and returning and try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Keith

customer_reviews.title: communication issues, but otherwise pretty decent
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is as can be expected from this type of printer in this price range. One thing that drives me bonkers is that it frequently disconnects from our home network and we have to manually re-enter the security key every time we reconnect. Since there is no keyboard and our passcode is like 16 characters long, life is rough when that happens. I have only tried printing pictures a couple of times, and after the paper dried, it was warped due to the liquid ink. Scan quality is pretty good, though. I have not attempted printing on other types of paper besides standard 8x11 office paper.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT LAST FIRST INK FILL
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT 3 OF THESE PRINTERS. THE CONCEPT OF FILLING INK IS GREAT. HOWEVER, ALL 3 PRINTERS LASTED LESS THAN 18 MONTHS. Epson support is non-existent just as bad as Dell. Do not buy these crap printers. 1 didn't even last through the first ink fill. Meaning I filled it and black ink needed filling one time the color didn't even run out and the printer got errors that no one at Epson could fix and warranty ran out. Hey EPSON DISPUTE THIS CHARGE! I WELCOME ANY SUPPORT TO FIX THESE BAD PRODUCTS. HEY IN MY BUSINESS I GIVE PEOPLE THEIR MONEY BACK WHEN PRODUCTS ARE RETURNED OR CLIENTS ARE UNSATISFIED.
customer_reviews.author: joseph mccoppin

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup but not the quickest
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup but not the quickest. It took close to 30 minutes to unpack, hook up, install ink, initialize printer, install and update driver. Now that it's up and running, I'm happy with it. Good quality print for standard use. Most likely for my occasional use, the amount of ink that came with the printer will last 2 years+ as advertised. UPDATE: I am a bit late with this update but thought it needs to be written. After a year of purchasing this printer and writing my initial review. I started having trouble with printing. First the color stopped working, then the black as well. Some research indicated that the ink jets were clogged. It became completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: Really like this printer
customer_reviews.text: Really like this printer. Pros: after initial upfront cost I've been amazed at how economical this printer is with using ink; Cons: a bit noisier than my previous printer, but I got used to that quickly. Also, resolution is good, not amazing. Have printed photographs with this printer, and they look ok, it's just their are better printers if you need to print up batches of photos. Overall however, I really do like this printer. In terms of ink usage, I never had a printer that was more economical than this one. That alone is a very good reason to buy this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Scotshiker

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thinking that I would finally have a printer that I didn't have to buy ink for every 3 months. But after 4 months of use it got an E-01 error code that makes this printer useless. Called customer support and they said that I had viruses in my wireless network so it was my fault and it would cost me to fix it. I have used many different printers and my recommendation is buy the cheap ones and if they fail after a few months its no big deal. Spending 250 dollars on a printer didn't get me anything better than the 19 dollar one I replaced it with. I will never buy an epson again.
customer_reviews.author: Nat Vim

customer_reviews.title: 2 Years and now E-01 unrecoverable error
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in August 2017 and its now dead in December 2019. E-10 error that Epson want $200 to fix. Printed about 1K pages in the 2 years. Mostly kids school stuff. print quality is iffy; heads constantly get clogged and head cleaning fixes problem only after many many cleaning cycles. Lots of alignment issues also causing me to run maintenance cycles multiple times before it becomes acceptable. I bought this for the promise of the eco-tank and that part has remained good: still have over 1/2 full from the first fill back in 2017. Now I have to find another printer and I hate the costs/smell/power draw of lasers so looking for another ink jet style printer.
customer_reviews.author: SamMo

customer_reviews.title: I had to play around with paper and settings to ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to play around with paper and settings to get the quality photo prints I wanted, but I eventually did. I use Office Depot glossy paper, but I choose "matte" on the printer. If I choose glossy on the printer, the ink will peel right off the paper. Weird.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Morris

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this printer for my daughter who is studying. This printer started to work perfectly, however, it started blotting after approximately 2 months. To date, the printer is not in use as it stopped printing the accurate colour as blue images/writing began printing as pink and the printer stopped printing colours in the accurate hue. The ink levels are still high and no additional ink was added, so this issue has not been the result of the wrong ink been poured into the ink tanks. Total waste of money. I regret choosing this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I've had this over a year. Do I love not having to buy ink all of the time? Yes! That's it. Everything else is a little disappointing. The quality of pictures...terrible. The quality of print...it's ok. After having a Canon that printed awesome pictures this printer is not even a little impressive in that area. I bought this because I got tired of paying for ink and having to constantly reorder it but....I'm getting close to going back to it. I'm biting my nails and hanging onto this because it's cheap to use but...you get what you pay for. The idea is great but the print quality, picture and print, needs a lot of improvement!
customer_reviews.author: GY

customer_reviews.title: Over a year later and still going
customer_reviews.text: I have this printer for home use which is not a lot of printing. Maybe a few sheets each week. Bought it in May 2019 and as of Oct 6, 2020 it's still going and ink tanks are more than half full. The only thing I would say is that I have the 2750 printer at work and that one has seemed to stop printing Magenta ink even though the tank seems half full. I tried cleaning the printer head multiple times but it won't fix it. I'm going to buy more ink and see if it's just a matter of some ink drying on the inside to make it appear like there's enough ink when there's really not.
customer_reviews.author: Chris P.

customer_reviews.title: Printer head requires constant cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Every time I try to use this printer I have to spend 20-30 minutes cleaning the print head multiple times in order to print clearly, and I must waste several sheets of paper printing nozzle test patterns. My use is limited to household printing, and I tend to only print once every few weeks. Still, I can leave other printers unused for months during the summer at work (I am a teacher) without any reduction in function. The ink does last much longer than inkjet cartridges, but the wasted time each time I print is infuriating. I would not recommend this product, nor would I ever buy another.
customer_reviews.author: MTFatBoy

customer_reviews.title: at best, but I would give it a rating of ...
customer_reviews.text: The printing quality was mediocre, at best, but I would give it a rating of three stars. After two months of mild use, the printing quality is bad and it's printing as if it's lacking ink though the panel shows that ink cartridges should not be replaced yet. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: momofthree

customer_reviews.title: Product Produced Flawed Results
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit a year ago. Even at first the photos didn't compare to those produced by my Canon Ink Jet (which I abandoned because of the high cost of cartridges.) The product worked reasonably well when I first used it. I didn't use it often and when I did the quality of the printed material deteriorated gradually. Now it produces horizontal lines in the photos. I tried Nozzle Check, Head Cleaning, and even Power Ink Cleaning to no avail. I will likely need to dispose it and purchase a Canon or Brother model.
customer_reviews.author: Prof W

customer_reviews.title: Constant Head-Clogging Issue.  Missing Colors. Cleaning Utility Does Not Work. AVOID
customer_reviews.text: When this first came out, I thought it would be a great solution to having to buy expensive ink cartridges. However, ink cartridges work. This Eco Tank has been terrible for printing. The scanner works fine, but the printer is a disaster. Any of the YMC colors will be completely missing. Right now, only the M and black works, making all the print jobs pink. I've gone through the nozzle cleaning process 9 times. This is an absolute waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: RealProductReview

customer_reviews.title: A fine purchase. Ink filling no problem--not a droop spilled
customer_reviews.text: A fine purchase. Ink filling no problem--not a droop spilled. Looking forward for 2-years of NO cartridges!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: This printer will fail!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer in My 2019. In November it stopped printing. After many hours on the phone with Epson support they finally did a return and replaced it under warranty. I have had the replacement for 5 months and now this one doesn't print. After a few more hours with Epson they want to send me a 3rd printer. I want a different printer- this one will stop working again in 6 months when it's out of warranty. Epson refuses. The print quality isn't that good when it works, I don't want their junk any longer. I asked for the phone # to corporate and they transferred me to eternal hold.... Terrible printer, terrible experience!!!
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: So worth it
customer_reviews.text: It’s this printer for my kids school program. I have finally upgraded to this printer and so far it’s been great. Supper fast, easy to use, AirPrint works flawlessly. Photos print beautifully. Tons more ink then last printer could ever dream of. The first day we had it we printed out several things and the quality compared to the previous printer was amazing. It really picks up the detail a lot better. Even on simple black and white documents it’s been great. Definitely worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Working mom

customer_reviews.title: Epson Inkjets are Great. This one uses Ink Bottles Instead of Cartridges so it is even better
customer_reviews.text: Epson printers have a well-deserved reputation for being quick to set up and produce great pictures. I have had two earlier ones so I got this for my wife when our laser printer suffered a terminal fuser failure. She is an artist and through her expensive laser printer was always too dark and "muddy" but she really likes the brighter, sharper colors of the ET-2650. We especially like the ink uses easy to refill bottles rather than the parade of cartridges most ink jets require. Doesn't do double-sided printing and doesn't have a document feeder but it produces great prints quickly and economically.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating technology that is not reliable
customer_reviews.text: This printer is just horrible. Even with full ink it fails to print consistently. It often stops functioning and requires complex steps to upgrade. Now, with the Catalina iOS, it will not work at all, regardless of software and firmware upgrades, reboots, etc. The user interface is difficult to read and use, with tiny display and complicated menus that are similar to the old flip phones; this feels quite outdated in 2019. The web support is not helpful. Based on my experience with this product, I would never consider buying another Epson product.
customer_reviews.author: Abe Lincoln

customer_reviews.title: Nozzles plug up
customer_reviews.text: the machine prints and functions great.. except when the nozzles plug up.. on mine they are now pluggled to the point i can not read the print. a search on line shows a kit with a syringe and some tips to blow out the plugs on nozzels. I am calling customer service as it appears to be under warranty and i am hoping this is a warranty item.. I have had several occasions in 9 months that I have had to use the clean print head and clean nozzels function.. this is the first time that has not worked..
customer_reviews.author: R. Baird

customer_reviews.title: I HAD THIS PRINTER FOR ABOUT 6 MONTHS, QUIT ...
customer_reviews.text: I HAD THIS PRINTER FOR ABOUT 6 MONTHS, QUIT WORKING IN THE MIDDLE OF A PRINT JOB, WHEN I WENT TO MOVE IT, TO CHECK THE INK TANKS, I GOT BLACK INK ALL OVER MY HANDS. THERE WAS A SMALL BEAD OF INK ALONG THE BOTTOM OF THE TANKS. THIS PRINTER WAS EXPENSIVE AND WAS NOT WORTH THE COST. IAM DONE WITH EPSON, AND IAM GOING BACK TO CARTREGES , FAR LESS MESSY.
customer_reviews.author: gary wilson

customer_reviews.title: Epson customer support exceptionally helpful.
customer_reviews.text: After a year of moderate use printer is now showing W01 paper jam error and will not clear. I can find no paper jam in the printer and all user manual will tell me is to clear paper jam. I am trying to contact Epson to resolve. Epson customer support determined that it was a mechanical problem and is sending a replacement printer. I am very pleased with Epson's response to my printer problem. Replacement printer received the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little more money and get the one that has the tanks up front and the feeder on top.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this copier for a few months now. It's not the best printer, it's slow and it doesn't print photos to my standards. The one thing I have a serious problem withit is if unplugged or the power goes out you have reset the printer. Which is a pain in the backside? I purchased the backup power source and alleviate that problem. More expense But I can plug my computera into it also, so I'm not going to complain. Would I buy it again? No, I would go up a model. I can get the one that has two tanks up front the feed from the top, I don't know why I didn't buy that in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Print quality is okay not terrible but not great either
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is okay not terrible but not great either. I would grade it a C+. The phone support is very very good!!! However, at six months in of casual use, I am already having to do a lot of print head cleaning. Phone tech suggested printing out once per day to keep ink from drying out. The price was right but in hindsight I wish I had spent a little more to get a better quality. Still the phone support has been fantastic. Definitely would buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: phloxicona

customer_reviews.title: Worst Printer Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the WORST printer I've ever owned since a dotmatrix It takes forever to print one page (like 2 minutes). Seriously. And the print quality is terrible. I want my money back!!! I was hoping it would be an ecologically sound way to limit throwing away plastic ink cartridges, but now I just want to throw away 20 pounds of plastic junk (the printer itself). C'mon Epson. Get it together. How could you put such a thing on the market? Don't think I'll buy anything made by Epson again.
customer_reviews.author: Another

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and good performance over 3 months
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this printer for 3 or 4 months now. Installation was very simple on our home network, and I was able to figure out how to set up 2 Win 7 boxes, a Win 10 laptop, and a Linux box to print through the network. Print quality is excellent, and the printer displays the availability of regular firmware updates, which are important for security. I love the concept of buying ink in "bulk" and putting it in a reservoir rather than constantly buying expensive cartridges. Of course, I don't have any information on how the machine will perform over the long term, but so far, we are quite pleased with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: nonotthatla

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: The bulk ink tanks are the bomb.... Yes the printer does cost more initially, but it is easy to see how it will be a savings over the life of the printer, My wife has a different model and we paid almost $120 more for it last year, so the prices have dropped. It is not as quiet as some printers.... but for me that is no problem..... the print quality is great on all kinds of paper even Photo Papers.... I print Business cards for my wife on Gloss Photo Paper, they are super nice.
customer_reviews.author: aceflier

customer_reviews.title: WIRELESS IS FLAKY
customer_reviews.text: GREAT PRINTER, but the wireless printing is not reliable... Sometimes it signs on to the LAN, sometimes it signs out and you cannot wake it up. I have tried giving it a static IP address and no luck. Giving up on having a reliable wireless connection with the printer. I have been all over the internet and there is no fix. The printer says it is signed in and at the designated IP, but the router does not see it, so my other computers cannot see it. Finally, I unhooked a powerline extender and it worked...at least for now. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus W.

customer_reviews.title: Epson Expression ET-2650
customer_reviews.text: On the surface, it's great, and the ink IS inexpensive. However, after having 2 eco printers, I can easily say that you NEED to run the nozzle cleaner at least weekly, or you need to print something daily, otherwise, it the nozzles will clog to the point that you use about 1/3 of the ink to run the cleaning cycles. Hint: If regular nozzle cleaning doesn't work after 3 tries, run the POWER Cleaning cycle, that has seemed to work best but uses a bunch of your ink to do so. All in all, I'll be going to Canon.
customer_reviews.author: SardonickTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Significant saves on ink, seamless wireless connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Rechargeable ink is a winner, very affordable ink tanks, wireless connectivity works like a charm, quiet, fast. Print from your cell phone (using EPSON app). This has been really an upgrade form my former HP wireless printer. The most significant improvement for me is the ink... with like $20-30 I am set for a year. Yes, I would recommend to a friend, to my mom, and to somebody that saved my life.
customer_reviews.author: MAF 123

customer_reviews.title: So cool!
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I ever bought for myself. I was sooooo sick of paying $40 for a single color cartridge that printed like 30 pages...This prints thousands. In fact, have had it a year and still nowhere near out of ink, even printing pics and anything else. Yeah, you pay more for the printer, but it pays for itself over and over in the long run!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Test picture printing from my phone to full page and PC to 4X6 were great with true color
customer_reviews.text: Thrilled with this product after years of HP printers dying in a year and hundreds of dollars spent on ink cartridges. I was leery of the wireless but set up was a breeze. Test picture printing from my phone to full page and PC to 4X6 were great with true color. Picture from my tablet was a bit muddy but I wouldn't use that feature anyway as I rarely use the tablet's camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase in Years
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase ever..... I print out a lot of color material and the old cartridges were costing me a fortune. This printer prints great photos on glossy photo paper that rival my Canon printer. The only thing I learned was that when you set it up connect the printer directly via usb cable to set up the wireless connection. (you can remove the cable once set up) as the tiny screen is a pain in the ass to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ron B

customer_reviews.title: working well after a few years.
customer_reviews.text: We do not print much. However, for the same volume of printing this printer has proved to be a million time better than our previous ones. The large ink tanks are perfect. We are not running out of ink all the as with previous printers. quality and stuff is fine. It scans well but i wish you could feed the scanner through the paper feeder. You have to do it by placing the originals in the scanning/copying "bed" one sheet at a time. that is my only gripe. overall, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: P. velosa

customer_reviews.title: The ink feature is really great
customer_reviews.text: Not having to buy those expensive ink cartridge is really great. I have had my printer for about 3 years now and am still using the original ink that came with it. On my old printer with ink cartridges, I would have gone through a about $100 by now.
customer_reviews.author: J. Amend

customer_reviews.title: That was easy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Set up was breeze, take the tape off, fill the tanks, press a few buttons and let it sit for 20 minutes. Connected to my wifi wifi then I did a test print from each of my devices and voila' it actually printed. My last printer experience was poor and this one is great. Thanks Epson
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Only good thing was Eco-Tank
customer_reviews.text: This printer broke down (failed motherboard) today, two months after its two-year warranty expired. decent printing quality, but wireless function never worked for me and it had trouble reliably interfacing with the Macbook even when hard-wired. The only thing I liked was the eco-tank feature; refilling can be a little messy, but ink seemed to last MUCH longer than cartridges in the Canon and other printers I had before this.
customer_reviews.author: Buster 65

customer_reviews.title: so good. Have only had for a little over a ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Have only had for a little over a week and am looking forward using it more. Really love the idea of the ink not drying out. We were so over do for an upgrade. Our last printer was purchased, get ready for it, in 2006. While it was a good printer, it was more than time for an upgrade. Nothing more aggravating than going to print and have dry cartridges again. So, I am excited to not have that problem anymore. YAY!!
customer_reviews.author: MBless

customer_reviews.title: Great printer ink is less expensive than regular ink jets
customer_reviews.text: Great printer ink is less expensive than regular ink jets. The printer is fast and provides great color copies at lower prices. Have had for a few months and printed 300 plus pages and have not needed to refill the ink. Ink refills are less than 30 bucks and looking to only have to refill no more than once a year. The only want would have been two sided printing but that does not retract from this great quality printer. Would highly recommend to anyone needing to print higher volumes than normal.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Far better printers for the money.
customer_reviews.text: No major complaints, everything works as intended. I had previously owned an epson workforce printer and upon receiving this printer I realized how cheap this printer is compared to a workforce printer. There are no cassette holders for the paper, so the paper just sits outside the printer exposed, and you cannot store very much paper in the load feeder. You can only scan 1 page at a time, and you cannot scan or print two-sided. This is a very basic printer, not worth the money. There are far better printers for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dibbs

customer_reviews.title: Great printer. Easy to set up and maintain
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. Easy to set up and maintain. Love the fact that I don't have to spend a lot of money on ink cartridges. If I had to have 1 negative thing to say about the printer is that the black print is not as sharp as my my HP printer. That being said, for my purposes this printer is doing exactly what I need. It does a decent job at printing photos as long as you use photo paper and set it up to print on photo paper in the print dialog box. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Richard E. Resnik

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service and poor performance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this new in September 2018. EPSON replaced it under warranty in July 2019 when the printer failed. Now in May 2020 the replacement has failed AFTER JUST 118 PAGES PRINTED however EPSON refuses to replace it. Very poor customer service. They basically told me to go pound sand. I have left a message with Kim Kommando telling her that her recommendations on EPSON Eco-Tank printers are basically worthless. I worked for two large Japanese companies in my career and neither one would ever treat their customers the way EPSON has treated me. Shame on EPSON. Shame on Kim Kommando.
customer_reviews.author: RYOBIMIKE

customer_reviews.title: Very Versatile Printer
customer_reviews.text: I got this printer to replace an older Epson printer and I love it! It prints on paper, cardstock, magnet paper, photo paper, etc. I love the large capacity ink tanks. I have had the printer 4 months and the ink tanks still look full. I use the printer for my home office and can print from my phone or ipad. I also use the printer for digital scrapbooking. My husband and son can print homework and work reports from downstairs (printer is upstairs). I really love the ease of use and versatility of this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Susie J.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT printer!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this printer more than 5 stars I would!! Not only is the print quality great, but the features are A+++. It comes with huge bottles of ink that will last much longer than an expensive cartridge would, and so much easier to deal with. The ink level display is easy to read and has not even moved since I purchased this printer a month ago. I don't know why anyone would want anything other than this product. LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Laurel Kimber

customer_reviews.title: Not Sure how long it will last!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer in Sept 2019, Jan 2020 the paper feeder stopped working, it was only pulling the paper in from one side jamming the feeder. I reached out to support and after some trouble shooting they determined the printer was broken. They sent me a replacement and the process was easy and simple. However, they could only send me a refurbished unit, the one I bought was brand new and only lasted 3 months. Not happy about that. Hopefully this one last longer.
customer_reviews.author: PLynn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have document feed, a feature so basic I didn't even think to make sure it had it at this price. Not too many small businesses have the time or inclination to open the lid, position a piece of paper, close the lid, make the copy, open the lid, remove the paper, position page 2, close the lid, repeat. Absolutely ridiculous. Of course, if the document feeder is anything like the paper feeder, you'd be making the copies that way anyway because it pulls 2-3 pages each and every time, even with new paper, fanned ever so gently, and lovingly inserted into the feeder tray. Oh, and photo picture quality is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: xx Zen AF xx

customer_reviews.title: Ink Lasts a Very Long Time
customer_reviews.text: Finally after 18 months of printing of many, many things, we have run out of black ink and have bought a refill bottle for $10. We don't print a lot of color things but often enough and there doesn't seem to be any end in sight of the color ink left to use. We have saved hundreds of dollars, probably more than double the price of the printer and had we continued to use a printer that required ink cartridges, we would have given up on color printing more than a year ago. When my child moves out of the house and takes this, I will be buying myself one immediately.
customer_reviews.author: S Ware

customer_reviews.title: Great - never buy another HP printer
customer_reviews.text: Great - 1000 times better than buying HP ink cartridges. I’ve printed 2 meter high stack of paper of computer code on ONE black ink bottle ($12) which would likely have cost me at least $250 in HP cartilages. Software and plastic for the printer is not as good as for HP printers - but who cares, it works as requied. HP printers were built on consumers buying many hundreds of dollars of ink cartridges per printer. You pay more for ink tank printers compared to the price for HP printer (which is being subsidized by future purchases of expensive cartridges). An ink tank printer pays for its self in less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S. Olsen, PhD PE

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: Set up was easy. It connected to our home network just fine. Not the fastest printer but works fine for home printing. Ink was easy to fill and I expect it to last a very long time. Print quality is pretty good Update: I change my mind. After 5 months the print quality has deteriorated tremendously. If I want a decent print I need to clean the heads a couple of times and usually do a head alignment also. Ink is holding up well but that’s about the only thing good about this overpriced mess.
customer_reviews.author: David Georgiades

customer_reviews.title: It saves ink, just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: We do a lot of printing, almost daily. I have yet to fill the tanks since I first set it up. If your looking for a photograph quality, this isn't your printer. If you print a lot of documents, using print cartridge after print cartridge and are tired of buying all those cartridges, this may be your printer, the setup was easy, good step by step instructions. I an impressed by it.
customer_reviews.author: Don Sporer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Was Looking For
customer_reviews.text: YES! I had sworn the last time I bought a $60 ink cartridge that I wouldn't do it again. When my printer started showing gaps and fades that was it... Filling a TANK with ink seems SO much more better and intuitive. I have a replacement fillup so even IF Epson blows up and implodes immediately at least I've got several year's worth of printing ahead of me. Well done Epson!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Woodcock

customer_reviews.title: Very eco-friendly and easy to use, just no ADF
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting to buy this printer for a while. True to its reviews, this printer is very economical. I like the ecotank design and how I don't have to buy cartridges all the time. I also use Google CloudPrint with this printer and it works perfectly. The scanner also works really well. My one complaint is that it doesn't have an ADF at this price, and that you have to manual duplex. Those are minor inconveniences for me.
customer_reviews.author: TheBandageMan

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Software cumbersome & difficult. One sided print only. Can only scan 1 page at a time. If I recognized this before purchase, I wouldn't have bought this piece of junk. Now I cant return it. Should have shopped at costco.
customer_reviews.author: aruna

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi printer connects to all my computers1
customer_reviews.text: The printer was excellent once I got it connected. Instructions are limited. Tech. support??? They weren't a lot of help. They couldn't solve my problem. On hold for twenty minutes w/ phone support... still didn't solve problem. 8 hours later I finally got it to connect. (so many trials & errors, I not sure what I finally did to connect. Once done it worked fine. Scanner is excellent. Print quality excellent. I bought this because I always was out of ink with my old printer and couldn't tell ink was low. Now to see how it holds up over time...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I’ve ever had for home use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent print quality. Saves a tremendous amount of money on ink. Clear instructions helped assembly, software installation, fill ink. Wireless printing from both iOS & android devices worked flawlessly. Just need to make sure the printer & device from which you are printing from is connected to the same network as I have 2 at home. Best investment of the year!
customer_reviews.author: kiki

customer_reviews.title: Ink clogs heads if printer isn't used often
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to avoid the waste associated with replaceable print cartridges, and ended up having to replace the entire device. If the printer sits without printing anything for a few weeks, the dried ink clogs the print heads. The self-cleaning mode did little to solve the problem, and the more dramatic cleaning still left some lines on each page that wouldn't print. For a low-use situation like ours, this printer was a terrible purchase. Don't buy it unless you plan to print something almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s a winner. I’ve only used this for two days, but it was easy to set up to my laptop, my iPhone and my iPad. The print quality is better than I expected. The print is crisp and clear, the color is good. The speed is much faster than my old printer. I didn’t give it a 5 star review only because I want to see how it holds up. At this point I would buy it again. Did not need tech support. I’m 71 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Ann

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance, cost efficient/ ink efficient.
customer_reviews.text: This printer is so ink-efficient, and with an excellent quality of the print. When my old Epson was coming to it's "senior years" I thought I might have to send out my calendar for professional printing but decided to try a new printer instead. I am so pleased with the quality of the print and have already printed 10 calendars and many more other items with only a tiny dent in the ink levels. It prints on regular and specialty papers. I can even print on cardstock.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Erdmann

customer_reviews.title: Color stopped working at 9 months
customer_reviews.text: After 9 months I had no color printing. Cyan, Yellow, and Magenta quit completely. Black still worked. I bought more ink instinctively but it was hardly low. After verifying it should print 6000+ color pages, I realize the ink purchase was stupid as the test sheet shows I've only printed 150 color pages. Epson is sending a "refurbished" unit and my year warranty will be affective from the original purchase date, meaning I have 3 months remaining warranty on this refurbished unit. If it breaks in 9 months, guess it'll be a phone call overseas to someone who "yes sir, completely understands my concerns, but unfortunately........"
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Prints over 1,000 pages of black before refilling
customer_reviews.text: I like this printer (tired of refilling old cartridges). It is hard to clean the print head after 1000 sheets, but head cleaning is an option that works. 0.25 inch borders are possible. I could have had better print-ware to make posters easier to print, but I'm not doing that often. Good printer, easy to connect to PC as well as WiFi. Plus Epson will provide an actual e-mail address for the printer: anyone can send a print to the printer, ie doc, pdf, text or email. It will print that on paper from outside your home.
customer_reviews.author: WJett

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good... I am tired of buying printers at least every year. They all break with very little use. Something has to go wrong. This one doesn't use cartridges, which is why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer -  Now I have 2
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Epson Printer. The cost of the ink is very reasonable and lasts. The printer is easy to use and install. I bought a second Epson Printer because the first printer I purchased a year or so ago, has worked well. When I needed another printer, buying the Epson again was a no brainer. The price of the printer was reasonable and the items printed are of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy C

customer_reviews.title: Prints Great
customer_reviews.text: Prints great. Excellent print quality. Did not come with USB A-B cable necessary to integrate with computer. (Use the cable from previous Epson Printer.) On Mac, delete old printer icon from Doc. When new ET-2650 icon appears, choose Keep in Doc in order to control scan and other printer functions. (Tech support doesn't tell you about this.)
customer_reviews.author: sushiguyus

customer_reviews.title: Warning
customer_reviews.text: I spend so much more time trying to get this to print than it takes to actually print. It works right intermittently after spending 5 minutes to almost an hour. The big giveaway that it won't work right is it comes with a program to figure out why it won't work. Not just a troubleshooter for windows or a help file, an actual program. It's no better a few months in, still have to use the trouble shooter, even after installing on a different computer, network, modem, router and ISP.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Only Useful for black and white printing
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a complete piece of trash for any type of color. Green and yellow don't print, reds never come out CLOSE to what they should. This is with firmware upgrades, settings tweaks and use of several different programs to test. Hours spent trying to get this thing to just get in the ballpark of useful. It's not. Do not throw your money away on this horrendous product unless you want to mass print black and white documentation, as it provides passable quality in bulk when not printing color. Otherwise, stay away.
customer_reviews.author: ITDave

customer_reviews.title: Technology on that function was truly pathetic! Purchased for the ink function
customer_reviews.text: Slow and the set up is a true pain - clicking through the scroll function on the printer was enough to make me want to put it back in the box and ship it back. Technology on that function was truly pathetic! Purchased for the ink function. If you have the patience to deal with the set-up, I think you will be happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRINTER FOR SUBLIMATION PRINTING!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this printer for sublimation and works like a charm. To not have to buy a separate ink system was fabulous! I wish I could print in 13x19 but this does do 11x17 so it was worth the trade off to get the built in ink tank. I never even used the ink that came with it, I will save that for another printer down the road, as I am sure these refilled tank printers will be replacing the old models soon.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Berrieault

customer_reviews.title: amazing, tons of ink
customer_reviews.text: this is the best printer i have ever had! i dont fall for advertisements, but shaq dancing around about big bottles of ink, right when we were in need for a new printer. thanks shaq for bringing it to my attention. this is a great printer, fast, easy fast set up. and the best part large bottles of ink, no stupid cartridges with there minuscule ink supply. honestly i can waste tons of ink and still have enough for atleast two years
customer_reviews.author: M. griffin

customer_reviews.title: Print mania
customer_reviews.text: love this but a note here the ink will not last me as long as they say. I print on best quality, color. and the ink has gone down. In all fairness I print for junk journals and It is a lot better than the other type of printer and I am finding it easy to learn. Have not had to check out tech support but I think they will be there when and if I need them.
customer_reviews.author: Davis, P.

customer_reviews.title: EcoTank Printer
customer_reviews.text: Control logic was slightly different from previous printers, but once understood the machine works well. Especially like the paper feed. Right side up makes proper loading of paper and envelopes easy to remember. Printer quality very good for an ink jet.
customer_reviews.author: David O. Ahrens

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing results:  No Color Printing!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for home use and not heavy use at that. My printing needs are intermittent and, for the most part, printing in B/W is my usual mode, with color printing being occasional but important. I find it prints black OK.....but colors are near to invisible. I've done all the cleaning/aligning routines many times to no avail. I had high hopes for a printer like this for the price, but am disappointed....and here I sit with full tanks of ink and unable to use it as desired.
customer_reviews.author: Dinah Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Irregular
customer_reviews.text: Have had this printer for over a year. Ink tanks are a great idea and are what sold me on this printer. Great printer when it can sync with network devices which needs to be redone regularly and is successful irregularly. Would be a printer I could recommend if it had a hard wire connection or could sync up wireless reliably. As it stands this printer is a hassle I am done dealing with, I am getting rid of this printer and going a better route.
customer_reviews.author: Penny J McKay

customer_reviews.title: Printer no longer connects to wifi after firmware update
customer_reviews.text: Epson bricked my printer with an automatic firmware update. It no longer connects to wifi, cannot connect it to any Epson utility via USB cable to re-flash it, and no flashdrive option. I would not recommend purchasing this printer. I have been working with Epson for 2 hours doing the same thing over and over passed from one tech support agent to another. I guess two years of ink is worthless if the device doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley L.

customer_reviews.title: Good...for 8 months
customer_reviews.text: The printer worked fine, until it didn't. After only 8 months of very light use it gives error message E-01. The highly technical troubleshooting provided by Epson included unplugging it. Needless to say, that did not work and now I have to either spend hours on the phone with their tech support or throw it away and buy a new one. I do not recommend buying this model under any circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk + Poor Customer Service= Unpleasant Experience
customer_reviews.text: This product has been a total waste of my time and money. Within three months of purchase and after printing fewer than 100 copies it has failed. But what's even worse than the machine's failure is the lack of customer service provided by Epson. The Epson company, right up to the corporate level where I took my complaint regarding this purchase, is anything but a customer friendly organization. My advice to anyone considering purchasing this, or any other Epson product is, run don't walk away from Epson, towards any other manufacturer or seller of printers!
customer_reviews.author: Loren Drummond

customer_reviews.title: Well it lasted 1.5 years. So much for the "ecotank" feature
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer because of the "ecotank" feature. After hearing countless times on radio I said why not? Plus the notion the ink laster longer is good. Well, after 1.5 years the printer doesn't print anymore. Tried everything. Who has time to spend hours with customer support to be told ship the printer to fix it? Lesson learned: don't ever buy Epson printer again. Onto the next brand...
customer_reviews.author: LSBerg

customer_reviews.title: This was the perfect printer for us since we can get ink cheap ...
customer_reviews.text: We had owned a photofinishing shop and believe me we know about the cost of printer ink! This was the perfect printer for us since we can get ink cheap and it seems to last forever. The Wifi is great and works well with our MAC desk top.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C. Dowdy

customer_reviews.title: Printer options, I.e. double sided printing, picture quality and color reproduction.
customer_reviews.text: Not really user friendly. Limited print options. My older printer, while starting to show it's Age, still out performs and has more options than this one. This one also does not seem as well built as my older printer. Definitely will look to other brands next time. Obviously, Epson is trying to force buyers into higher priced printers in order to get better quality and more options.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Vanyo

customer_reviews.title: So far, Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have had HP printers for years. The HP printer died and I bought this one from Epson. I wanted something that I didn't have to replace the cartridges constantly. I am impressed with the print quality and the easy set-up of the printer. It is a little involved but simple and the directions are clear. I would recommend this printer to others.
customer_reviews.author: Hayden B. Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: After only ~200 pages of printing color and black and white, I started seeing missing lines in my prints. I performed the print head cleaning as when I printed the print head check page, it came up with lines missing. After doing so, it did help but there were still some spots in text it printed where you could see "missing" ink. Will perform print head cleaning again. does not print very fast and have had several communication errors over wireless when printing with windows 10. There have been several software updates that seem to have made this better.
customer_reviews.author: stephen

product_meta.title: Epson Expression ET-2650 EcoTank Wireless Color All-in-One Small Business Supertank Printer with Scanner and Copier
product_meta.description: Style:PrinterThe Expression ET 2650 EcoTank wireless all in one offers revolutionary cartridge free printing with easy to fill, supersized ink tanks. It includes up to 2 years of ink in the box (1). That’s an incredible amount of ink — enough to print up to 4,000 pages (2), and equivalent to about 20 ink cartridge sets (3). The ET 2650 delivers an unbeatable combination of convenience and value, giving you the freedom to print anything you want in color, without worry. Plus, save up to 80 percent on ink with low cost replacement bottles (4). The ET 2650 features built in wireless for printing from tablets and smartphones (5), plus a 1.44" color LCD and built in card slot (6). (1) Based on average monthly print volumes of about 150 pages. (2) Included ink bottle yields based on the ISO/IEC 24712 pattern with Epson’s methodology. Actual ink yields will vary considerably for reasons including images printed, print settings, temperature and humidity. Yields may be lower when printing infrequently or predominantly with one ink color. All ink colors are used for printing and printer maintenance, and all colors must be available for printing. For more information, visit our official site. (3) About 20 cartridge sets estimate based on print yields of the included Black and color ink bottles as compared to standard capacity ink cartridge sets for similarly featured cartridge printers as of July 2016. (4) Savings comparison based on the purchase cost of replacement ink bottles and the cost of enough cartridges to achieve the total page yields of the bottles using the manufacturers' online prices and yields for the highest capacity cartridges for the best selling, similarly featured consumer inkjet printers priced at $499 or less per NPD, July 2016. Actual savings will vary based on print tasks, print volumes and usage conditions. (5) Most features require an Internet connection to the printer, as well as an Internet and/or email enabled device. For a list of Epson Connect enabled printers and compatible devices and apps, visit our official site. (6) Adapter may be required. (7) Wi Fi CERTIFIED; level of performance subject to the range of the router being used. Wi Fi Direct may require printer software.
feature_bullets: Epson strongly recommends the use of Genuine Epson inks for a quality printing experience; Non Epson inks and inks not formulated for your specific printer may cause damage that is not covered by the Epson warranty
Cartridge free printing comes with up to 2 years of ink in the box (1)
Includes enough ink to print up to 4,000 pages black/6,500 color (2) equivalent to about 20 ink cartridge sets (3)
Save up to 80 percent on ink with low cost replacement bottles (4) plus easy to fill, supersized ink tanks
Built in wireless, plus Wi Fi Direct (7) — easily print from iPad, iPhone, Android tablets and smartphones (5); print wirelessly without a network
Unbeatable combination of value and convenience the freedom to print anything you want in color, without worry

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars1,278 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
